results.title: Metabolic and structural bone disturbances induced by hyperlipidic diet in mice treated with simvastatin.
results.text_hl: @<m>DISEASE_Bone_Diseases_Metabolic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001851 @@@Metabolic and structural bone disturbances@@@ induced by hyperlipidic diet in @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

results.title: Effect of simvastatin on bone markers in osteopenic women: a placebo-controlled, dose-ranging trial [ISRCTN85429598]
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Women@@@ (n = 24) with @<m>DISEASE_Bone_Diseases_Metabolic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001851 @@@osteopenia@@@, assessed by broad band ultrasound attenuation, were randomized to @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 20 mg, 40 mg or identical-appearing placebo for 12 weeks.

citations.NLM: Hsia J, Morse M, Levin V. Effect of simvastatin on bone markers in osteopenic women: a placebo-controlled, dose-ranging trial [ISRCTN85429598] BMC Musculoskelet Disord. 2002;3():7. PMID: 11879528

results.title: Simvastatin promotes osteoblast differentiation and mineralization in MC3T3-E1 cells.
results.text_hl: These results indicate that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ has anabolic effects on bone through the promotion of osteoblastic differentiation, suggesting that it could be used for the treatment of common @<m>DISEASE_Bone_Diseases_Metabolic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001851 @@@metabolic bone diseases@@@ such as @DISEASE_Osteoporosis @DISEASE_MESH:D010024 @@@osteoporosis@@@.

citations.NLM: Maeda T, Matsunuma A, Kawane T, Horiuchi N. Simvastatin promotes osteoblast differentiation and mineralization in MC3T3-E1 cells. Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2001 Jan 26;280(3):874-7. PMID: 11162604
citations.BibTeX: @article{11162604, title={Simvastatin promotes osteoblast differentiation and mineralization in MC3T3-E1 cells.}, author={Maeda T and Matsunuma A and Kawane T and Horiuchi N}, journal={Biochem Biophys Res Commun}, volume={280}, number={3}, pages={874-7}}

results.title: The effect of simvastatin on the differentiation of marrow stromal cells from aging rats.
results.text_hl: These results indicate that @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ has anabolic effects on bone through the inhibition of adipocytic differentiation and the modest promotion of osteoblastic differentiation, suggesting that it could be used for the treatment of common @<m>DISEASE_Bone_Diseases_Metabolic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001851 @@@metabolic bone diseases@@@, such as aged @DISEASE_Osteoporosis @DISEASE_MESH:D010024 @@@osteoporosis@@@.

citations.NLM: Liu M, Wang K, Tang T, Dai K, Zhu Z. The effect of simvastatin on the differentiation of marrow stromal cells from aging rats. Pharmazie. 2009 Jan;64(1):43-8. PMID: 19216230
citations.BibTeX: @article{19216230, title={The effect of simvastatin on the differentiation of marrow stromal cells from aging rats.}, author={Liu M and Wang K and Tang T and Dai K and Zhu Z}, journal={Pharmazie}, volume={64}, number={1}, pages={43-8}}

results.title: The effect of simvastatin on periprosthetic bone mineral density in the hypercholesterolaemic patients after total hip arthroplasty.
results.text_hl: There were no significant detected changes of BMD in ROI 4. In the @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ group, the percentage of @<m>DISEASE_Bone_Diseases_Metabolic</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D001851 @@@BMD loss@@@ was significantly less (P < 0.05) in ROI 1, 2, 6 and 7 throughout the study period than the control group.

citations.NLM: Zhang X, Sun Y, Xie H, Liu J, Zhao Y, Xu Z. The effect of simvastatin on periprosthetic bone mineral density in the hypercholesterolaemic patients after total hip arthroplasty. Int Orthop. 2018 Jan;42(1):59-64. PMID: 28681228

results.title: Simvastatin prodrug micelles target fracture and improve healing.
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@SIM@@@), a widely used anti-lipidemic drug, has been identified as a bone anabolic agent.

citations.NLM: Jia Z, Zhang Y, Chen YH, Dusad A, Yuan H, Ren K, Li F, Fehringer EV, Purdue PE, Goldring SR, Daluiski A, Wang D. Simvastatin prodrug micelles target fracture and improve healing. J Control Release. 2015 Feb 28;200():23-34. PMID: 25542644
